document.title: Content Standards and Grade Level Expectations English Program 2022

D552381C4989435E86246E71766A4160.description:
Accurately use general, academic, and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career-readiness level. Demonstrate independence when using a
word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

89D022E078AE4848B86AD7362D772E9B.description: Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career-readiness level.

98D6EF3C029C41868176692F61FF7E03.description: Analyze differences in the meanings of words with similar denotations and connotations.

3318E282047344F78D49FA0B06AF2363.description:
Interpret figures of speech (e.g., oxymoron, hyperbole, paradox) in context and analyze
their role in the text.

D8A1588AE7904A0E9F144C155E0FE2C1.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

E7DBE944D73E47A381FDCA09C454A53C.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

DEE2E78856B0440086D3E0FB98D7D0E7.description:
Verify the preliminary determination of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by
checking the inferred meaning in context or in a dictionary).

182051F992D1438EB4CE58D7BCB4D212.description:
Consult general and specialized reference materials (e.g., college-level dictionaries,
glossaries, thesauri), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word, parts of speech, spelling, origin, meaning, and usage.

E3D91E18556949678FE1B12499EEBB4E.description:
Correctly identify and use patterns of word changes that indicate different meanings or
parts of speech (e.g., conceive/conception/conceivable).

61A40D5CF4AA4CB0B6F932AB4B5FC910.description:
Use context (e.g., the overall meaning of a sentence, paragraph, or text; a word’s position
or function in a sentence) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

E50E54E248594731AD146F20A9B26B12.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on
appropriately complex reading and content, choosing flexibly from a variety of strategies.

73D4A6A688A649848281077413F68662.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting reference materials.

CC12D0166176490CA346EF99D496C71E.description: Apply knowledge of prepositions and prepositional phrases.

EFBF3B9AEACE436E81B18309A6604023.description:
Apply knowledge of connecting words and expressions (e.g., coordinating and subordinating conjunctions, conjunctive adverbs, transitional expressions, relative
pronouns, correlative conjunctions). +

E9F34B1E64FE4774ABD6C7E480F21785.description: Apply knowledge of comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs. +

AB819057CA3E46CEA733496C6397F2EF.description: Apply knowledge of tag questions and direct/indirect questions. +

EC44D17E14FE44A3A21F0B1FBC3D9207.description:
Apply knowledge of subject-verb agreement (compound subjects, indefinite pronouns,
collective nouns, inverted word order). +

624A07E43F564CB98847381F31833557.description: Apply knowledge of verbals (e.g., infinitives, participles, and gerunds used as adjectives and nouns) and modal auxiliaries (e.g., can, could, shall, should, will, would, must, have to, may, might, ought to). +

B48879816C544A9680AB35E513F3A89D.description: Apply knowledge of verb tense sequence (e.g., compound/complex sentences). +

1E03D7E548D04F11965EF0A7F885C9DD.description:
Apply knowledge of verb tenses (e.g., simple present, present progressive, simple past, past progressive, future, future progressive, and present perfect, including irregular
verbs).

FA23B6E748894C2FACE4E360A06435D6.description: Apply varied syntax rules for effect, consulting references for guidance as needed.

2265A2E031C543A9A18B39B45B40473F.description:
Apply knowledge of language to understand how it functions in different contexts, to make effective choices
for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

5F9079D37AEB4E05B8EB77ECB318855D.description: Demonstrate understanding of how language functions in different contexts, making effective choices for meaning, style, and comprehension.

A7E29FA5C51340AD9714AD323089615D.description: Use punctuation marks correctly. Observe hyphenation conventions.

12137125AA134F9F9D11256F76765CC3.description: Demonstrate command of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions when writing.

0E570A7590B14CA2A26143C521D2C0A0.description: Apply appropriate English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions.

9696279D2B1443999212E4B7EAF1FC99.description:
Identify, analyze, synthesize, and use diverse syntactic and semantic language structures
in context. +

32C9DDF601BC46C2A3DD7A72C2CD91F3.description: Recognize grammatical modifications for stylistic reasons. +

0608CC673DDF4AD4B3EB91F21B079349.description:
Understand the meaning of different verb tenses, modal auxiliaries, and word order in
sentences, reported speech, questions, and phrases. +

6BD84BE0553442D4BBA881CEB02EEBE8.description:
Express thoughts in grammatically correct sentences and phrases in both oral and written
form. +

8DF6F12D5DE04FC49F8D235031D9B340.description:
Apply different types of sentences in various contexts. Assess various grammar and usage
texts and online resources. Analyze subject-verb agreement and parallel structure.

A5A446B876724E81B6D5F334A0AAF497.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions when writing and speaking.

6476B781702843C5B55F9BD0DA1E2FE4.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

D6C1D6268A0443608F4FCD9E209A7416.description: Write routinely for a variety of discipline-specific tasks, formal and informal purposes, and audiences, demonstrating research, reflection, and revision (e.g., integrating technology or digital/print resources).

5A62A21D4B134526928B982201CFDA8D.description: Write routinely over short and extended periods of time for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

9DD5E9458B224ECCA11B59096CB1FBCB.description: Cite evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

5FA0CEE99E174109A394E7310651F837.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

D7590192862B408F83C1893682A3B8BE.description: Conduct sustained research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question) or to solve a problem or job/university inquiry. Synthesize multiple reliable sources to demonstrate knowledge on the subject.

F83814695A8D406AB0F239C5CEC81E02.description: Conduct research projects of varying lengths based on focused questions to demonstrate understanding of the subject.

5F700048C8E9455FB315CDD6F5BAEEB9.description: Use technology, including the internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or shared writing products, linking to other information and displaying information flexibly and dynamically.

9939E255FFBA43E9B2E2567FFA1C3CDF.description: Use technology, including the internet, to interact and collaborate with others and produce and publish writing.

12C4026210F24405894F7F501912C48A.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning (e.g., using outlines and graphic organizers), drafting, revising, editing (using editing marks), rewriting, and publishing, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed, avoiding plagiarism, considering style guides (e.g., MLA and APA student format), and
using citations. +

7A1957A5828C4A489C589A5B6381C139.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, rewriting, and publishing).

364E3DE6AB894294AF8A08F696985B11.description:
Write narratives (e.g., short stories, memoirs, and journals) using transitional words and other cohesive devices
to better organize writing and develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective literary devices (e.g., techniques and elements), well-chosen details, and structured sequences in 5 or more paragraphs.

94322F56A5064C5CA025622833C35155.description: Write literary texts to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, details, and structure.

223278AC4E5E4A0887ADF93E10E0757E.description:
Write college-level essays (e.g., argumentative, expository, compare and contrast, persuasive, and process), research papers, and film reviews with independence and precision using appropriate text organization;
expanding vocabulary; and selection, organization, and analysis of content in 5 or more paragraphs.

E28FCB18D9BB40EFB733C638C07AE809.description:
Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the selection,
organization, and analysis of relevant content.

6A157B068B584BDEB51C3F644C008B34.description: Express, clarify, and defend viewpoints and opinions. Justify arguments with the support of the thesis statement and claims.

0BC4CF9637A340EEB45AAC0D4D9E73C1.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts using valid reasoning and sufficient evidence in 5 or more paragraphs.

13E1AB269DE74AAA82398CE673054979.description: Write arguments to support point of view using valid reasoning and relevant evidence.

A21F8FDEF3A54D0B8F35E4E457A2178D.description:
Read and demonstrate comprehension of a variety of culturally diverse literature (e.g., stories, dramas, poetry)
and informational texts (e.g., history, social studies, science, and technical texts) of appropriate complexity.

0F6D9DD8A25541F6B7AD7FE3327F912D.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

517AB00E4F6D4DCC94F087DC2A103E6B.description:
Analyze documents of historical significance (e.g., “United States Declaration of Independence”) from various time periods to identify their themes, purposes, and rhetorical
features.

A29690E7E4C7401599C6AE0814D10B15.description:
Analyze eighteenth through twenty-first-century works of American literature, including how 2 or more texts from the same time period treat similar themes or topics (e.g., how style and
historical background change over time).

197CDB2D804046CB8985CD841DA9143E.description: Compare and contrast 2 or more authors’ presentations of similar themes or topics.

74BF79033FFC429EB23C62839EFC4B67.description: Delineate and evaluate the reasoning in seminal texts, including the application of constitutional principles. This includes, but is not limited to, narrative, persuasive, and descriptive writing and knowledge of their qualities.

8C886B89C7B94E1096646CC141DFE897.description: Delineate and evaluate an author’s argument through evidence specified in a text.

3ABBBBE6CF04485CA74723048E0E7729.description:
Integrate and evaluate multiple sources of information presented in different media or formats (e.g., visually, quantitatively) and in words in order to address a question or solve a
problem.

672C9F01670C4C0C8836131C9520ABF5.description:
Analyze multiple interpretations of a story, drama, or poem (e.g., recorded or live productions of a play, recorded novels or poetry), evaluating how each version interprets the source text.
Include at least one play by Shakespeare and one play by an American dramatist.

82E2A2B5B244454BA0671A7ED01DECC0.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

5A2B018B104C4814804E55B86F6C70BC.description:
Evaluate an author’s point of view or purpose in a text in which the rhetoric is particularly
effective. Analyze how style and content contribute to the power, persuasiveness, or beauty of the text.

10113D256ED24333B7F1F13674B9E47C.description:
Analyze a case in which grasping a point of view requires the student to distinguish what is directly stated in a text from the actual meaning (e.g., satire, sarcasm, irony, or
understatement).

7EF67AECF02F4DF596D64BB07F5BBD7E.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

41EA8B40E4594255B0434A1C64DE2B36.description: Analyze and evaluate the effectiveness of the structure an author uses in his or her exposition or argument, including whether the structure makes points clear, convincing, and engaging.

36A157D7E3914264A919E6A49E94D168.description:
Analyze how an author’s choices concerning how to structure specific parts of a text (e.g.,
where to begin or end a story, whether to provide a comedic or tragic resolution) contribute to its overall structure and meaning and its aesthetic impact.

7ECA4624BE7044B5A75903F1CB8D4D32.description: Analyze the structure of a text, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., sections, chapters, scenes, or stanzas) relate to each other and to the whole.

CACB36E9723444EFA37811BA08559A0B.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings. Analyze how an author uses and refines the meaning of a key term or terms over the course of a text (e.g., how Madison defines “faction” in “Federalist Papers No. 10”).

A0151D6A8A6E4A3BB071AAE2F7800707.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including figurative and connotative meanings. Analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including words with multiple meanings. Include Shakespeare as well as other authors.

B2FBF5B8A65E461BA488E84AA5812348.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings. Analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

C3D107C85137400B818810ADE1FB621B.description: Analyze a complex set of ideas or sequence of events and explain how specific individuals, ideas, or events interact and develop over the course of the text.

790A7CA4E9734D3D8CCF57533BC81DF0.description:
Analyze the impact of an author’s choices regarding how to develop and relate elements of a
story or drama, including symbolism, motifs, setting, plot, and characterization.

161303027D40438F88823AE5E20A8BB1.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

F6F0555C32814E99A6E038B67184D8A6.description:
Determine 2 or more main ideas of an informational text and analyze their development over the course of the text, including how they interact and build on one another. Provide a
complex analysis and objective summary of the text.

FD70266B6277441C8AC45AC6E811A772.description: Determine 2 or more themes (e.g., hate, love, etc.) or main ideas of a literary text and analyze their development to provide a subjective summary.

A57EB034FC5B4DB29F40638D997DB479.description: Determine main ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development. Summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

5C059991A27A4F02A909FBC8B451BA71.description: Explain inferences and conclusions drawn from texts to support analysis.

EB186B17AC294D1DB8B21865597A04EE.description: Determine and explain facts/details that support main idea(s) from the texts.

742231642B4B4EF3975216C8DFC1B44A.description: Distinguish and explain fiction vs. nonfiction.

AF89501C4B6F4A268125BE332DFC707E.description: Distinguish and explain fact vs. opinion.

DFC773FBB2B94AF49C6F9D7D89AF5719.description:
Evaluate, analyze, research/synthesize, and document inferences and conclusions drawn from in-depth critical reading of appropriate texts and viewing of multimedia. Interpret ideas, increasingly complex phenomena,
processes, genres, and relationships within and across texts.

88DF9A0EBFBE4D05973E73C816A8E160.description: Read critically to make logical inferences and cite specific textual evidence to support conclusions drawn from the text

8BCBA68A6F664F7D80F42C6B0669B44A.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

C12117745BC8449F986C913501AE5581.description:
Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with appropriate purpose, intonation, expression,
and understanding.

C54B369CDE6648CEBC466C6DEC15555A.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

8A59EB2B22A94AEF89ECFB0C578A1C9C.description:
Accurately and automatically read grade-level texts with appropriate patterns of stress, intonation, or
expression.

438B7234C1F04B75A3DF230453D4D0E3.description:
Process encoding sounds through letters (s,r), consonant blends (sh, sk), digraphs (ay, ew),
or trigraphs (sch, thr) using conventional spelling patterns to form words.

2C819083AC454AB7A95B4BE79D6C2FFE.description: Apply meaning to single units of sound in existing word parts to encode a given word.

FE3183FA50A64A29B01370262A8BE6B1.description:
Accurately read multisyllabic words using a combined knowledge of all letter-sound
correspondences, syllabication patterns, prefixes, and suffixes.

2743BD9D2E2E4CBDB9AD24744710F337.description:
Use a combined knowledge of strategies to encode grade-level monosyllabic and
multisyllabic words.

1D737B27B6714F1D8F0A994C2FD7447F.description: Understand and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to decode and encode words.

6D590531311C419CAF99C764B6C02060.description: Refer to previous grades as needed to reinforce these skills.

192ECA57C28D47C59249E0C8562D956B.description: Phonological awareness (rhyming, blending, segmentation, deletion, isolation, substitution)

2F0DC3A25AF1443487187748414BF463.description:
Produce complete complex and compound sentences, recognizing and correcting
inappropriate run-ons and fragments.

66E7212204C34654A5D1FC36AD5050E1.description:
Understand that ideas are connected through cohesive devices and larger meaningful
chunks of text.

7DF5BB1A7B15499EBE03516B18A81298.description:
Provide complex reference information of source(s) applying required MLA and APA student
format.

F550F1E04EC44A56A11CB95C1C86DD86.description:
Cite or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others avoiding plagiarism and following a
standard format for citation (e.g., MLA and APA student format).

26AD1375F0964EC9AAFBD0E521746950.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources to assess the credibility
of each source.

4815FD6A460044D6BF6B0A7CF0BAC224.description: Recognize relevant information from multiple reliable print and digital sources.

2EABCAB547014742AA2A90FFE1D9A1BB.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

4FFDAA3D17254F909DAB840EB3833437.description: Apply knowledge of direct/indirect quotations to strengthen oral presentations. +

84ECD414B1504504A9AFD535DE723569.description:
Plan and deliver a variety of oral presentations and reports on social, academic, college, and career topics that present evidence and facts to support ideas and demonstrate understanding of formal and informal
registers. Integrate a variety of technology, print, or digital resources in presentations and reports.

EC1F04A3A88046E2BAEDE3459D905352.description:
Plan and deliver different types of oral presentations/reports to express information and support ideas in social, academic,
college, and career settings.

DD721616D3E54C3DA0F74B4BCDDD2DED.description: Use techniques for overcoming cultural and linguistic barriers to communication. +

3DA4608538AB48C9AA433BB25F200C44.description: Apply language choices in different contexts for different purposes and audiences during speech deliverance.

8C89BFB01F45444EAF0AC9634176809A.description: Adjust language choices according to the task, context, purpose, and audience.

160218EBE14D46CD870CFF185381205C.description: Negotiate with and persuade others during discussions and conversations using acquired vocabulary and open responses to express and defend point of view.

90A6BFFCF88E40188D29A1B4A967ACB4.description: Provide, justify, and defend opinions or positions in speech.

4884D32909394D3F9F80283D60B89C19.description:
Accurately and appropriately use a variety of grade‐appropriate general academic and content‐specific academic, social, college, and career-ready words when producing complex spoken texts and when telling, retelling, explaining, and analyzing stories; personal experiences; and current, social, college, and career
events.

F2F3E9881D18466288168CD2FBDFE2E5.description: Contribute to social, academic, college, and career conversations using accurate and appropriate language.

93D042F771F74DE2991C345A3198808D.description:
Critically analyze closed- and open-ended questions and answer them with logical
arguments and knowledge.

FF606037060E4FC6958808F83EFDEDF6.description:
Synthesize, analyze, and debate information, justifying answers with details from texts,
self, and experiences.

89566EC2FE1242C3A78DEC8422267039.description:
Listen to, discuss, and respond to complex instructions and information during group
discussions.

B7AC1E9A381E4B56BF5F06DE38442494.description:
Respond orally through closed- and open-ended questions about real-life and academic situations and
answer questions demonstrating knowledge of the topic.

38CFC4F0656D4CCE8C226AA0699D6743.description: Evaluate information and determine appropriate responses to answer questions effectively.

F275C97C7F0142EBBF326B6C28999C60.description: React to others with relevant information by paraphrasing, evaluating, analyzing, and synthesizing ideas. +

7F9EE15A298147D889DD9C94683D614F.description:
Contribute to class, group, and partner discussions. Sustain conversations on a variety of appropriate and
relevant academic, social, college, and career topics by following turn‐taking rules and asking and answering
on‐topic.

3DA652F80B144337AE4B8C14826F45C2.description:
Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics in diverse contexts and with different
audiences.

C84FCE64DB234D4181981846437B588B.description:
Listen and respond to synthesize, explain, support, and discuss information. Answer and
formulate closed- and open-ended questions. Listen to, classify, and prioritize information.

550BEE04B9184765A79ABF1FFCDF3472.description:
Listen and respond during a read aloud, presentation, or performance from a variety of
literature, periods, genres, and styles to analyze character development and setting and to distinguish the characteristics of tone, voice, and mood. Make connections to the text.

705756760B1E424092C506FCF7B7F08A.description:
Work with peers to establish norms for discussions and decision-making, analyze information and key ideas, establish goals based on knowledge and individual roles, and
demonstrate respect for diverse perspectives.

BDBEC86F2F1744A7B8348997D41CA1E8.description:
Demonstrate comprehension of oral presentations and discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics by asking and answering questions that show critical
consideration and extension of the ideas or arguments.

D3AD7AC925EE400EBBE20552292D7B3B.description:
Listen to and interact with peers during class, group, and partner discussions, developing logical arguments to
expand upon conversations on a variety of grade-appropriate academic, social, college, and career topics.

35C1D525BE8247C5B1255698DA96E47E.description:
Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic,
college, and career topics.
